xxl.core.math.functions
Class DistinctMetaDataAggregationFunction<P,A,M>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.functions.AggregationFunction<P,A>
      xxl.core.math.functions.DecoratorAggregationFunction<P,A>
          xxl.core.math.functions.MetaDataAggregationFunction<P,A,M>
              xxl.core.math.functions.DistinctMetaDataAggregationFunction<P,A,M>
Type Parameters:
P - the type of the aggregated values.
A - the return type of the function, i.e., the type of the aggregate.
M - the type of the mata data provided by this aggregation-function.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, MetaDataProvider<M>
public class DistinctMetaDataAggregationFunction<P,A,M>
extends MetaDataAggregationFunction<P,A,M>

This class realizes a metadata aggregation-function performing an early duplicate elimination during an aggregate operation.
Using this function in an Aggregator offers the ability to perform SQL statements like: 

        SELECT DISTINCT SUM(A), DISTINCT AVG(B)
        FROM Table1
        WHERE ...
A DistinctMetaDataAggregateFunction decorates a given MetaDataAggregationFunction and and uses a bag to realize the duplicate elimination. That means, the elements of the input cursor are inserted in the bag and the specified predicate determines during the execution of the query() method, if an element in the bag matches with the next element, the aggregate should be computed with. If no predicate has been specified in a constructor, the predicate Equal is used as a default.
So the next aggregate, i.e. function.invoke(aggregate, next), is only computed, if the bag does not contain the next element the aggregate function will be invoked with.

Since a DistinctMetaDataAggregateFunction extends MetaDataAggregationFunction, it has to provide meta data information. Therefore the meta data information of the given MetaDataFunction will be passed during a call to getMetaData().

See Also:

Creates a new DistinctMetaDataAggregateFunction.

Parameters:
function - a MetaDataAggregationFunction computing an incremental aggregate, e.g. SUM, AVG, ...
bag - a bag used to store the input cursor's elements.
predicate - binary predicate determining if an element of the bag and the next element, the incremental aggregate should be computed with, are equal

DistinctMetaDataAggregationFunction

                                           Bag<P> bag)
Creates a new DistinctMetaDataAggregateFunction. Uses a default instance of the predicate Equal.

Parameters:
function - a MetaDataAggregationFunction computing an incremental aggregate, e.g. SUM, AVG, ...

DistinctMetaDataAggregationFunction

public DistinctMetaDataAggregationFunction(MetaDataAggregationFunction<P,A,M> function)
Creates a new DistinctMetaDataAggregateFunction. Uses a bag generated by Bag.FACTORY_METHOD.invoke() and a default instance of the predicate Equal.

Parameters:
function - a MetaDataFunction computing an incremental aggregate, e.g. SUM, AVG, ...
Method Detail

invoke

public A invoke(A aggregate,
                P next)
Overrides the invoke method with two parameters used by XXL's incremental Aggregators in the packages xxl.core.cursors and xxl.core.relational.
If the size of the bag is greater than 0, the bag is queried in order to check if the next element is already contained in the bag. If this is the case, the last aggregate is returned. Otherwise the next element is inserted in the bag and the aggregate is incrementally computed as usual.

Overrides:
invoke in class MetaDataAggregationFunction<P,A,M>
Parameters:
aggregate - aggregate
next - next element of the input cursor
Returns:
last aggregate, if next is contained in the bag, otherwise the new computed aggregate is returned

the metadata information.
